windows.symptom: hoe do i combine my hard drives 2 together        no videos well help
solutions: What OS build are you on?  Hit the Windows key, type winver, hit Enter.Or Windows key+r, winver, OK

In what way do you mean you wish to combine them? Do you mean that you want to move all of the data from one to the other, like a clone? Do you mean you want them logically connected into a single spanned volume? Do you mean you want them RAIDed together so one is shadowed to the other? Please be more precise in describing what you want.

Hello,See if this guide helps you:https://www.kapilarya.com/how-to-combine-multiple-disks-into-single-volume-in-windows-10Let us know if this helps!Note: Included link in this reply refers to blog post by a trusted Microsoft MVP.

windows.symptom: how to prevent automatic windows update        I  wish to check what the windows update does and only install ones I want. There are too many that I do not need.
solutions: Hi azoreslady you haven't mentioned whether you have windows 10 home or pro. with pro you can use group policy to inform you that updates are available and only download (and install) when you are ready. (let me know if you have pro)with build 1909, you have the option to delay updates, (in both home and pro) for up to 35 days, once you have checked for updates you can pause it again for another 35 dayssettings -> update & security -> windows update advanced options under pause updates, select a date. (after checking for updates, you can click pause updates for x days to pause for the same period)or you can set the network connection to metered, this will stop feature and driver updates but will still allow the important security updates and definitions for defender. (it may also restrict data usage of some apps)settings -> network & internet -> status click on "change connection properties" turn on "set as metered connection"
hit the win key, type Services, Click on Services at the top, Scroll way down to Windows Update, click on it, Change Start up to Manual.You then can check when not busy.  Should check daily.

Hello,You can use Group Policy to block automatic updates. This ensures updates are downloaded/installedonly when you want them:1. Open GPO snap-in by running gpedit.msc command.2. Go to Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Update.3. Double click Configure Automatic Updates policy setting, select Enabled. Then under 'Configure automatic updating' section, choose 2 - Notify for download and notify for install.4. Click Apply, followed by OK.Multiple reboots will finally disable auto updates.Reference: https://www.kapilarya.com/avoid-windows-updates-automatic-download-windows-10Let us know if this helps!Note: Included link in this reply refers to blog post by a trusted Microsoft MVP.

windows.symptom: Windows Update service missing 0x80070424 , Windows 10 Pro x64 1803 [Solved]        Hi all.I've just managed to solve this issue, not being able to find any solution over the Internet after several days of search, test and fail, so I'm sharing it here in case somebody is in the same situation. I hope it is not against any policy doing so.Version: Windows 10 Home/Pro x64 1803 Issue:    Missing service Windows Update, as a result of deletion  ( sc delete wuauserv ) . Stupid stupid action, I know, but in Home edition, I was out of ideas to avoid automatic updates not having gpo.             Running services.msc doesnt show the Windows Update service. In Regedit the key[HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv] doesn't exist or is empty.             Windows Store update and download also show errorserror:    0x80070424 when trying to refresh updates manually               0x80070006 after a wrong .reg recoveryWindows update troubleshooter, both the one in the windows settings or https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/10164 , fail to run. The last troubleshooter also includes running:DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth  sfc /scannowI tried using a .reg available online to recover the service, located at this place: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/57567-restore-default-services-windows-10-a.html . The service was back but I have then the error  0x80070006.  It might be due to being a different or early Windows version.I asked a friend with a Professional 1803 version (we also used different languages for install and run Windows) to export his services\wuauserv registry. I imported it, restarted, and my updates are back. I honestly hope it might help someone out there. Best luck if you need to use it.Cheers, JosepsDo the registry import as usual: copy all the text under the line in Notepad or a text editor, save it, change the extension to .reg and run it. Accept the security warning and restart.edit 24/12/2019 , as per @k1nd3r suggestion I'm deleting an unnecessary blank right under the separation line :)Windows Registry Editor Version Man, you are awesome! I had this problem for a while now, and it turns out that this 'winlogui.exe' trojan has removed my windows update. This has been driving me crazy for a while now. Your solution works and windows update is back now. PS. I had to use another antivirus to remove winlogui.exe first, and then i had to apply your solution. I am sure there are a lot of folks who have this kind of problem out there. So, thank you very much.

I am sure there are a lot of folks who have this kind of problem out there. So, thank you very much.You are welcome. I'm really happy knowing this has been helpful. Hi all.I've just managed to solve this issue, not being able to find any solution over the Internet after several days of search, test and fail, so I'm sharing it here in case somebody is in the same situation. I hope it is not against any policy doing so.Version: Windows 10 Home/Pro x64 1803 Issue:    Missing service Windows Update, as a result of deletion  ( sc delete wuauserv ) . Stupid stupid action, I know, but in Home edition I was out of ideas to avoid automatic updates not having gpo.             Running services.msc doesnt show the Windows Update service. In regedit the key[HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv] doesn't exist or is empty.             Windows Store update and download also show errorserror:    0x80070424 when trying to refresh updates manually               0x80070006 after a wrong .reg recoveryWindows update troubleshooter, both the one in the windows settings or https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/10164 , fail to run. The last throubeshooter also includes running:DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth  sfc /scannowI tried using a .reg available online to recover the service, located at this place: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/57567-restore-default-services-windows-10-a.html . The service was back but I have then the error  0x80070006.  It might be due to being a different or early Windows version.I asked a friend with a Professional 1803 version (we also used different languages for install and run Windows) to export his services\wuauserv registry. I imported it, restarted, and my updates are back. I honestly hope it might help someone out there. Best luck if you need to use it.Cheers, JosepsDo the registry import as usual: copy all the text under the line in Notepad or a text editor, save it, change the extesnsion to .reg and run it. Accept the security warning and restart.Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv]"DependOnService"=hex(7):72****00"Description"="@%systemroot%\\system32\\wuaueng.dll,-106""DisplayName"="@%systemroot%\\system32\\wuaueng.dll,-105""ErrorControl"=dword:00000001"FailureActions"=hex:****\  6b****\  00"ObjectName"="LocalSystem""RequiredPrivileges"=hex(7):53****\  00****\  6e****\  00****\  69****\  00****00"ServiceSidType"=dword:00000001"Start"=dword:00000003"SvcHostSplitDisable"=dword:00000001"SvcMemHardLimitInMB"=dword:000000f6"SvcMemMidLimitInMB"=dword:000000a7"SvcMemSoftLimitInMB"=dword:00000058"Type"=dword:00000020[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\Parameters]"ServiceDll"=hex(2):25****00"ServiceDllUnloadOnStop"=dword:00000001"ServiceMain"="WUServiceMain"[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\Security]"Security"=hex:01****\  01****00[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\TriggerInfo][HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\TriggerInfo\0]"Type"=dword:00000005"Action"=dword:00000001"Guid"=hex:e6****e0[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\TriggerInfo\1]"Type"=dword:00000005"Action"=dword:00000001"Guid"=hex:c****50( change the extesnsion to .reg and run it. Accept the security warning and restart.).... what is the exact procedure, i realy dont understand how registry import is done, i would appreciate it if you show me step by step on how you go about it. am not good at this computer staffs

Hi,I just realized there's an easy way to create the reg file:1- open Notepad2 - select and copy the text under the line in the first message and paste in into the notepad3 - save the file as fix_update.reg in your desktop4 - double click fix_update.reg , and accept the security message.5 - reboot and check if the service is back (in the Task manager tab or Services app)Good luck!

Hi all.I've just managed to solve this issue, not being able to find any solution over the Internet after several days of search, test and fail, so I'm sharing it here in case somebody is in the same situation. I hope it is not against any policy doing so.Version: Windows 10 Home/Pro x64 1803 Issue:    Missing service Windows Update, as a result of deletion  ( sc delete wuauserv ) . Stupid stupid action, I know, but in Home edition I was out of ideas to avoid automatic updates not having gpo.             Running services.msc doesnt show the Windows Update service. In regedit the key[HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv] doesn't exist or is empty.             Windows Store update and download also show errorserror:    0x80070424 when trying to refresh updates manually               0x80070006 after a wrong .reg recoveryWindows update troubleshooter, both the one in the windows settings or https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/10164 , fail to run. The last throubeshooter also includes running:DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth  sfc /scannowI tried using a .reg available online to recover the service, located at this place: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/57567-restore-default-services-windows-10-a.html . The service was back but I have then the error  0x80070006.  It might be due to being a different or early Windows version.I asked a friend with a Professional 1803 version (we also used different languages for install and run Windows) to export his services\wuauserv registry. I imported it, restarted, and my updates are back. I honestly hope it might help someone out there. Best luck if you need to use it.Cheers, JosepsDo the registry import as usual: copy all the text under the line in Notepad or a text editor, save it, change the extesnsion to .reg and run it. Accept the security warning and restart.Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv]"DependOnService"=hex(7):72****00"Description"="@%systemroot%\\system32\\wuaueng.dll,-106""DisplayName"="@%systemroot%\\system32\\wuaueng.dll,-105""ErrorControl"=dword:00000001"FailureActions"=hex:****\  6b****\  00"ObjectName"="LocalSystem""RequiredPrivileges"=hex(7):53****\  00****\  6e****\  00****\  69****\  00****00"ServiceSidType"=dword:00000001"Start"=dword:00000003"SvcHostSplitDisable"=dword:00000001"SvcMemHardLimitInMB"=dword:000000f6"SvcMemMidLimitInMB"=dword:000000a7"SvcMemSoftLimitInMB"=dword:00000058"Type"=dword:00000020[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\Parameters]"ServiceDll"=hex(2):25****00"ServiceDllUnloadOnStop"=dword:00000001"ServiceMain"="WUServiceMain"[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\Security]"Security"=hex:01****\  01****00[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\TriggerInfo][HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\TriggerInfo\0]"Type"=dword:00000005"Action"=dword:00000001"Guid"=hex:e6****e0[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\wuauserv\TriggerInfo\1]"Type"=dword:00000005"Action"=dword:00000001"Guid"=hex:c****50thank you so much!!!!!!!!!!I hope I can download apps from Microsoft Store now and update my windowsedit:I can now download apps and check for updates!! windows.symptom: Swap windows computer - new account sign in        Hi there, I want to give my newish desktop unit to another family member permanently - as her new computer.  Trouble is it already has my account attached from when I first started it with preloaded w10.  Rather than format the entire PC and start again, so she can log in with her account, how can I swap the log in accounts to set her up as a the main user and the remove my account?   Make sense?
solutions: Hi FamilySF Open the Settings App (gear icon on your Start Menu) Go to Accounts - Family and other People Click 'Add someone else to this PC' Follow the prompts to create a new account (making sure to accept the defaults, so it is an admin account)Close the settings app Log out of your user account Log into the new account Click the Start Button, type netplwiz and hit Enter In the resulting dialog, select the old account and click 'Remove' That's It, the new Admin Account will replace your old account
Thanks DaveM121, I'll give it a whirl this weekend.  Greatly appreciated.

windows.symptom: Upgrade from Windows Prof 7 to Windows 10 Pro        I am getting Error 0x80070002 - 03x3000D , the installation failed in the FIRST_BOOT phase with an error during MIGRATE_DATA operation.
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you are facing issues upgrading your computer from Windows 7 Pro to Windows 10 Pro. We will certainly assist you with this issue. For better understanding, please let us know:What is the make and model of your computer?Do you have multiple operating systems (dual boot) on your system? Before we proceed, make sure to disconnect external devices such as printers, scanners (except keyboard and mouse). Put the PC in clean boot, refer the article How to perform a clean boot in Windows. A ‘clean boot’ starts Windows with a minimal set of drivers and startup programs. Note: After you finish troubleshooting, follow the sectionReset the computer to start normally after clean boot troubleshooting to reset the computer to start normally. Also perform hardware clean boot and check.Press Windows key + R. This will openRun. Alternatively, you can go to Start and search for Run.In Run dialog box, type devmgmt.msc and hitEnter. Now expand the Display adapters, Printers, Sound, video and game controllers. Now right click on the drivers inside the section and click onDisable. If asked for restart click on restart later and disable all the drivers.Close the device manager window. I would also suggest you to check the steps mentioned in Get help with Windows 10 upgrade and installation errors You may also want to check the solution provided by Karen_Hu in theTechNet Thread. Note:  Important this section, method, or task contains steps that tell you how to modify the registry. However, serious problems might occur if you modify the registry incorrectly. Therefore, make sure that you follow these steps carefully. For added protection, back up the registry before you modify it. Then, you can restore the registry if a problem occurs. Follow the steps to take backup of registry.  We await your response. Aditya RoyMicrosoft Community – Moderator

Feel free to ask back any questions and let me know how it goes.Thank you!

windows.symptom: NOT ABLE TO OPEN WINDOW PHOTOS        AFTER OPENING IT'S SHOWING LIKE THIS
solutions: Hi mrfailure0 Open the Settings App (gear icon on your Start Menu) Go to Apps and find the Photos App in the list Select the Photos App and choose 'Advanced Options' - Reset When that operation completes, check to see if the Photos App will open for you . . .

AFTER OPENING IT'S SHOWING LIKE THISHello,See if this fix helps you:https://www.kapilarya.com/fix-photos-app-file-system-error-in-windows-10Hope this helps!Note: Included link in this reply refers to blog post by a trusted Microsoft MVP.

solutions: Здравствуйте. Какая ошибка? Хотя бы скриншот прикрепите. Также попробуйте другую папку для сохранения файла. Где качали сам фотошоп?

windows.symptom: Driver for old HP DESKJET 520        HII have an old HP DESKJET 520 that was functioned perfect im WIN 7 with a driver for the Deskjet 500 that was then found by Win update in the installation program.When I try to install the 520 now in WIN 10 the installation program does not find the driver for 500.BUT ................WHEN A friend of mine from an other favorite forum perform a "fake" installation his Win update finds the 500 - driver.VERY STRANGE I THINK.But then I would like to ask if it iss possible to find the "file" in the friends pc and copy it and then he sends it to me.Then I use his file in my system after I have piced my "file" out.After that I run the installation process an perhaps the system can use the new 500-drive and perhaps my Deskjet 520 will function.Perhaps a deam, but I really want to keep and use our old friend the HP DESKJET 520I just have to make a perhaps last try.I wish you aHAPPY NEW YEAR.Staffan
solutions: Hi, You can't find a driver because HP DESKJET 520 is Old printer. Don't use a "driver files" from Unknown source.
HI ThanksMy friend gets the HP 500 as an alternatiive when he runs win update in the installation process.Why can I not get it ?Staffan

Hi Staffan Try this method. 1. Right Click the "Driver" installer. 2.Click "Troubleshoot Compatibility". 3.Click "Troubleshoot program". 4.Check the box: "The program worked in earlier versions of Windows but won't install or run now", and Click "Next".5. Click "Windows 7", then click "Next". 6. Click "Test the program".
No luck that waySorry

The difference may be down to the version/build of Windows 10 or the edition. (Home or Pro)What is your current version and build plus edition against you friends build. Type winver in Search and select the top result to check.
By the way, Make sure your printer is connected to your PC.

windows.symptom: Disabling the volume control banner on PC        Hi,So I was wondering if there is a way I can stop the controls shown in the picture from popping up every time I adjust the volume? They are rather annoying in my opinion. ***Original title: Hiding the windows video player controls.***
solutions: You can't hide it no way.Btw. This forum is for finnish language. English language is here.

Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you want to remove the volume control banner on your PC. This issue started after the latest version of Chrome was released. However, we can disable the banner by changing some settings in Chrome browser. Kindly follow the steps below to fix the issue. Open Google Chrome.Now type in the following command on the address bar:chrome://flags/#hardware-media-key-handlingUnder Hardware Media Key Handling select the drop down toDisabledRestart Chrome Let us know how it goes. Regards,Prakhar KhareMicrosoft Community – Moderator

windows.symptom: Configure 'Access this computer from the network”        Hello Community,As per the microsoft docs, Policy -  Access this computer from the network - security policy settingapplies to only to Windows 10.I could see most of policies applies only to windows 10, those polices will not support to other operating systems like windows 2008R2 & 2012&2016 servers?Regards,Puneeth
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you are looking for group policy “Access this computer from the network” for other Windows operating systems. However, for queries related to Group Policy, let me help to point you in the right direction. I would suggest you to post your query inTechNet Forums where you will find professionals with expertise on group policies for Windows operating systems and that would be the appropriate forum. You may also want to check: Access this computer from the network. The document applies to Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012. Regards, Aditya RoyMicrosoft Community – Moderator

windows.symptom: Creating System File (Recovery File)        I bought a new Sureface Pro 6 and ive been trying to create a Recovery Drive on USB Drive which looks OK. when I started the recovery after choosing the USB Drive, It shows an instructions said to format the flash drive to NTFS.after formating the USB Drive to NTFS and re do Creating System File (Recovery File) it still gives me the same message to format the flash drive to NTFS.Can anyone tell me what to do with this issue.thank you...
solutions: Hi Amadani,I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.Because you have a Surface device, please use Surface recovery Image to create a recovery drive. It is better option than Recovery drive.See the first section here. https://support.microsoft.com/en-in/help/402351...

Even though they are still included in Windows, recovery drives really are legacy technology. Instead of recovery drives, today we make image backups of the hard drive.An image backup is an exact copy of your hard drive. They take only minutes to make, and minutes to restore, and when restored your computer reverts back to exactly as it was when the image was made, with nothing to re-install, update, repair, recover or test.Moreover, image backup software makes it easy and convenient to create a backup every day, or even several times a day, automatically, while you continue to work on the computer.Why spend time trying to fix your computer - if that even works - or reinstall Windows from scratch, update it, re-install your software, setup your computer as you like it, restore your personal files from backup, and then test everything to see if your efforts succeeded, when in a matter of minutes you can be back at work as if nothing had happened to your computer? Image backups are the modern way to confident and stress-free computing.

Hello, my name is Arif Ahmed, Windows Advisor. I would be happy to help you. Please perform the following steps to create a USB Recovery Media for your Surface.Go to the following page and select your Surface Device. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/surfacereco...Download the Recovery Image for Surface. Keep the flash drive as FAT32. Clean the flash drive. Insert the Flash Drive and extract the contents from the Recovery Image to the Flash Drive.Boot the PC.

windows.symptom: Transferring Windows 10 Pro from laptop to Desktop with missing key?        I have a laptop with Windows 10 Pro that I will be selling. I have Windows 10 Home key available that I want to put on the laptop and give my desktop Windows 10 Pro, but I am missing my activation key that came with the laptop. Is there a way to do this?
solutions: If the laptop came with Windows 10 Home, then its product key is most likely embedded in the BIOS and you won't need a separate key. If thelaptop came with Windows 10 Pro already installed, then that's what you should reinstall on it. If it already has that on it, just reset it, removing all user files.

The laptop came with Pro installed, but I want to reinstall Home onto the laptop and bring the Pro version over to my desktop. My only issue is that I'm not sure where I put my folder for the laptop which contains the Pro Activation Key. I tried the command 'wmic pathsoftwarelicensingservice get OA3xOriginalProductKey' but it doesn't provide anything.
The laptop is licensed for what came originally installed and you cannot legally move that to another PC unless it is a retail license that you purchased separately from the PC.

It's a custom laptop from Clevo that uses a desktop processor, they installed the OS and included the installation disc in what they mailed me.I guess I'm not sure about the legality of it, but dont see why it would matter as long as it's just on 1 device.

Hello Steve, i'm Timon and i'm glad to help you. Activation depends on what type of license you have. If Windows came preinstalled with the computer, this is called an OEM license: the license is linked to the motherboard and is non-transferable.If you are in this case, you can't transfer your licence. The story is different for retail licenses, but it requires the licence to be linked to a Microsoft Account.To find out whether your Windows 10 license is OEM, Retail, or Volume, use these steps:Open Start. Search for Command Prompt, right-click the top result, and select the Run as administrator option.Type the following command to determine the license type and press Enter: slmgr /dli

windows.symptom: Microsoft store app doesn't open        My windows 10 's microsoft store app does't open.I saw some advise in community. I checked Date, Time, Region. I did app reset in windows setting. I did run (wsreset.exe).Neither one didn't work.I also tried to leave feedback at Feedback Hub, but Feedback Hub app also not working.Would appreciate if any help.
solutions: struggle to open Microsoft store

Hi Stephen, My name is Marc, thanks for participating in the Microsoft Community, I'm an Independent Advisor and I'll be glad to help you today.Let's try to return to the correct functioning of the Windows Store, follow the steps of the official links, some steps have been applied by you, you can reapply them, or continue with the next one.Press Windows key + I >> Settings >> Applications >> Applications and features >> Locate Microsoft Store >> Advanced options >> Reset.Fix problems with apps from Microsoft Store https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402749...Microsoft Store doesn't launch https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402733...Reinstall the Windows Store Press Windows key + X >> PowerShell (Run as Administrator) >> Copy and paste, using the mouse button:Get-AppXPackage * WindowsStore * -AllUsers | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$ ($ _. InstallLocation) \ AppXManifest.xml"} + Enter, wait for the process to finish, then it is recommended to restart the computer.Let me know if you have something else that I can help you with, I'd be happy to help.Happy nice day Regards, Marc M.

My windows 10 's microsoft store app does't open.I saw some advise in community. I checked Date, Time, Region. I did app reset in windows setting. I did run (wsreset.exe).Neither one didn't work.I also tried to leave feedback at Feedback Hub, but Feedback Hub app also not working.Would appreciate if any help.Hello, Try re-registering Store app. Perform these steps: 1. Search for Windows PowerShell using Cortana or Windows Search. 2. From results, right click on Windows PowerShell and select Run as administrator. 3. Then type following command and press Enter key: Get-AppXPackage *WindowsStore* -AllUsers | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register "$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml"} Let the command complete. 4. Close Windows PowerShell. Let me know if issue still persists!

At "START, Settings, Update & Security, Activation", does it say Windows is activated...?...Many features will not work, if it isn't activated.

Thanks. I did every steps which you mention.But still didn't work.What would be next steps?Thanks again.Hey manMicrosoft saying a lot have simular issues atm.I had my first problem like this in 6 years with Win 10.It was my user that was corrupt. You can fix that by:First, you MUST have a real Win 10 license and a Microsoft account. Thats easy to create if you only have a local user.It will make your Win 10 into a digital license that you can link your new user/machine too. And you never need to remember the license. Its your account.And, Microsoft is VERY good with YOUR security regarding Microsoft account. They really are.To fix issues like the store dont work, Win defender is wierd and many others, there is 3 things you can do before you do a clean install, and make a complete new user.First. Activate the win 10 administrator account. Log in that. Try the store.If it works then, than your user is most likely corrupt.I have 3 suggestions. I would go with C.A. Make a new user. Must be administrator. Reboot. Then delete your old user.This works 100%, IF the issue is in your user, but you loose ALL settings, links and everything connected to your user. You need to reconnect to your Microsoft account, Office, google, etc.B. Same as A, but you copy FILES AND FOLDERS from your current user to the new one. NOT the whole thing.This way you keep links and licenses to games and software you dont have in steam, google, etc.HOWEVER, you may not fix the problem, because the issue could be in something you copy.C. Use a User cleaning tool. WARNING! There is NO Microsoft supported tool that can do this.There are tools who claims they cleans users, but a vast majority of them are malware. And worst case, locks your computer and transfer your account to them. However, these are not common anymore since....well.....Microsoft have made one bloody good OS in win 10. There is a tool I have tried and several good windows tech sites (non Microsoft) praise this tool.Its called Account Profile FixerI tried this myself 2020-01-03. And have run it on 4 other corrupt users in real (friends)I ran it, 30 mins later, I had my PC back, INCLUDING a new user, but with the same name and links.I had to reconnect Outlook, My Microsoft Account, the Microsoft store and several applications.My dragon Chrome I uninstalled before the clean, and installed fresh, and synced back all my usernames and passwords. (DONT SYNC GOOGLE ACCOUNT WITH SETTINGS AND APPS ON A PC IF YOU HAVE YOUR MOBILE CONNECTED TO IT!)It was a bit of hassle getting all my settings back. Pictures, background, theme.I did it all from scratch. I saved nothing in the cleaning, which I highly suggest no one else does.My PC runs faster, cleaner and all issues with microsoft store, windows firewall etc. Was gone.This is the link to the tool:https://www.carifred.com/apf/It is free, but so far got accepted by google. However, Be CAREFUL with this!The tool itself means you no harm. But it has very little defense against getting altered since its created by a regular guy, who made it and let anyone who wants to, download it.But It works!Important: You get 2 choices when you run the tool about what you want to save. SAVE NOTHING.Its only settings, not licenses and the important stuff.Follow the instructions and be patient. And you have a repaired user, with your current name.Your computer will reboot several times, and you will need to make a new password for your "new" user, when its done.I am getting quite familiar using this tool now.I'd be happy to answer questions about it. Even though the ONE person who created it, supports it.I donated 50 bucks to him. Thats how much I liked this tool.Jonas The Swedish Goth

windows.symptom: Clean install but upgrade from hdd to ssd.        current setup: hdd running 1903 (primary boot)target:1909 upgrade/clean install on ssd (then primary boot)1903 still bootable on hdd (secondary/backup boot) in case of failures of any kind.how would i manage that without an optical (which is being replaced by a tray caddy) or usb flash drive? can i partition the ssd to contain the setup data - in a recovery partition or somehow bootable - and install the os on itself and set up the boot record to use it after it's on? if not, could i use any type of installer that installs the os on the ssd from a setup run from hdd (while using the system), and which creates the boot record on the ssd to boot from it - after boot order change in the bios/uefi. means that the boot order regulates which os version is booted, with both being bootable and functional without intereference.tia
solutions: If you want to install Windows 10 version 1909 on the SSD you will need DVD or USB boot media, as far as I know USB is the only option using the Media Creation Tool.You could perhaps clone the HDD to SSD, assuming you can have them both connected at the same time.Just as a question, why no bootable USB?

yeh. i don't wanna clone this service and update mess and bloat it even further. hence why i wanna fresh install. jsyk... usb flash drives tend to corrupt on me. dunno why. i tried a couple manufacturers. good enough for video files, but i'd rather not have a faulty system installer on it. that's that.
There aren't the options you would like. As I said install media is USB or DVD.

Hello, my name is Arif Ahmed, Windows Advisor. I would be happy to help you. You can prepare a bootable installation media (Flash Drive) using the following tool.https://www.microsoft.com/en-in/software-downlo...You can use this flash drive to create a separate partition of the OS. However, the PC will boot from the Boot Priority Device. Hence you have to change the boot order to the SSD in order to boot from the SSD.In this case the PC will not act as a dual-boot system as the Operating Systems are stored in different storage devices.

alright. i guess i gotta test my luck with the thumb drive. hope it doesn't corrupt again.concerning the "dual boot": i'm aware of the priorities. this is planned to be a boot order switch, with the old os just being a backup. it's gotta remain functional tho. that's the point. if it has seperate boot data this should  work tho, right? then... it's all good. :)thx for now.
Have just the SSD connected at the time you install.
You're welcome

windows.symptom: Black screen and cursor before login        Yesterday my PC was updated to windows 10, I turned it off and the next day I turned it on it started up with the usual logos and start up sound, but the screen stays black and the cursor appears only when I kove the mouse. What do I do?
solutions: Hi, My name is Gary an independent advisor and I would be happy to help you out with your concern,I'd recommend creating a new user profile, to do this 1. Press and hold the control, shift, and escape key to pull up the task manager 2. Click on file and choose to create a new task 3. Under create a new task type in netplwiz 4. Once the user account window opens click on Add 5. Choose to sign in without a Microsoft account 6. Fill up the form and choose finish/done 7. Highlight the newly created user account from the user account/netplwiz window8. Hit properties and set it as an administrator 7. Sign in the account and see if the same behavior occurs. If the same issue occurs, I'd recommend performing a system restore 1. Press and hold the control, shift, and escape key to pull up the task manager 2. Click on file and choose to create a new task 3. Under create a new task type in rstrui 4. Follow the prompts and choose the recent restore point and process the system restoreIf you are not able to open up the task manager, I'd recommend performing a system restore through the windows recovery environmentYou may access the page by going to the sign in screen press and hold the shift key and press the on screen power button to choose the restart. It will then reboot and direct you to the windows recovery environment.Another alternative is, Start your computer, once the computer goes to the windows logo screen press and hold the power button for 5-10 seconds to shut it down completely. Do this for 3-5 times to force access the recovery environment.a) System Restore Go to Troubleshoot, advanced option, system restore (This would roll back the system's configuration to a specific time and date)Let me know how it goes. :)

windows.symptom: I have numerous files in files that I can no longer open.  Is there an adjustment I need to make?        On my desktop I have numerous files.  Inside one of those files i have a few dozen other files that I can no longer open.  I think I might have made an adjustment that I shouldn't have because I can't any longer open these files.  I also cannot delete my browsing history anymore and I have my favorites file with the yellow star that I have a few files and I can't either get them to open nor can I delete anything.  That "Favorites" is comletely unusable. z
solutions: On my desktop I have numerous files.  Inside one of those files i have a few dozen other files that I can no longer open. You need to tell the forum what type of files these are and what happens when you try to open them.

Example:  File I call documents contained files such as addresses, authors, purchases.  When I go into one of these files then click on the individual file I want nothing happens.  The computer and I sit here looking at each other. Example:  File I call jokes contains 270 separate jokes which I send out daily.  I click on a joke and nothing.  I have to copy - go to MSN inbox and click on message the click on attachment to open then I can send out.Example:  Favorites has numerous items.  When I click on one absolutely nothing happens.  When I click on organize favorites absolutely nothing happens.When I am in MSN Explorer inbox and click on E-Mail Settings - once opened I click on clear all browsing - absolutely nothing happens.  I simply cannot delete anything even thru Outlook either.  Not that long ago maybe 6 months all these things worked just fine that's why I think I may have hit something I shouldn't have.
You misunderstand. It does not matter what the files contain. What matters is the file type, e.g. Word (.docx), Excel (.xlsx), Text (.txt). Right-clicking a file will tell you the details.
Im Los Files
no work

When I right click on a file here's what I get:Open, Open with, Share with, Norton security, Restore Previous Versions, sent to, cut, copy, creat shortcut, delete, rename and properties.So then I right click on open ant I get:  Address is not validBut I do know tht when I originally made these files I had Word.  About 3 years ago I got a different computer and now has LibreOffice.

You need to remember:The left mouse button is the ACTION button. It opens files or folders, or it lets you click buttons.The right mouse button is the PROPERTIES button. It displays the properties of a folder or a file. It is NEVER an action button.To check the properties of one of your problem files, you do this:You right-click the file to expose the properties menu.You left-click Properties to see the details.You report the full file name & type. In my case it is 19-19.pdf, an Adobe Acrobat Document.
